channel.title: Niklas Pivic's CV
channel.description: Recent content on Niklas Pivic's CV

item.description: System requirements (into the actual System Requirements document, also) Planning the installation Installation Configuration Miscellaneous Logs Configuring the config file Troubleshooting Introduction [[Snow Extender]] is a standalone application that transfers local inventory data to [[Snow Portal]]. There are plans to move stuff, e.g. SaaS connectors, directly to SNaaS, so that Extender doesn’t have to be used for transferring those types of data. Data that is sent?

2020-12-10 Alessandro registers [[INVS-347 - Documentation for Extender]]. 2020-12-14 Alessandro and Niklas speak about the Jira issue. 2021-01-08 Initial meeting with [[Magnus Bellon]] on this. Exists in SharePoint OneNote [here](Snow Extender: ett första dokumentationsmöte (Webbvy). * Also documented in [[First meeting with Magnus Bellon]] 2021-01-21 ![[Pasted image 20210121151556.png]] 2021-02-03 I asked [[Alessandro Badin]] about who’s responsible for [[Snow Extender]]. He said this: that’s me as PO, Gunnar as EM, Kenneth and Rolf as ELs
Martin Christersson Inspelning av en walkthrough PowerPoint-presentation Möte med [[Magnus Bellon]], 2020-01-08, detaljerat [här](Snow Extender: ett första dokumentationsmöte (Webbvy).

Met with [[Magnus Bellon]] on [[2021-01-08]] and spoke about this. Meeting notes based on [[!structure]]: System requirements (into the actual System Requirements document, also) Planning the installation Installation Configuration Miscellaneous Logs Configuring the config file Troubleshooting

The Jira issue Documentation for Extender. What is registered in the Jira issue on 2020-12-10, when it was created: System requirements Planning the installation Installation Configuration Troubleshooting Responsibles [[Alessandro Badin]] mentioned these persons on 2020-02-03, as detailed in [[!timeline]]: [[Alessandro Badin]]: Product Owner [[Gunnar Mortensen]]: Engineering Manager [[Rolf Lunder]] and [[Kenneth Aas Hansen]]: Engineering Leads 2020-12-18 Martin Christerssons tips: Inspelning av en walkthrough PowerPoint-presentation

https://academy.snowsoftware.com/learn/course/8839/play/21227/platform-extender-installation-and-feature-walk-through [[Martin Christersson]] presents. Overview Application is installed on the customer side Gateway for sending data to SNaaS Works with current agents and SIM Receives data over HTTP/HTTPS or .snowpack files Sends data to SNaaS over HTTPS ![[Pasted image 20210119152213.png]] Installation Standard path: C:\ProgramData\SnowSoftware\PlatformExtender Files C:\ProgramData\SnowSoftware\PlatformExtender\extender.exe: Executable for both GUI and Windows service C:\ProgramData\SnowSoftware\config.json: Configuration file C:\ProgramData\SnowSoftware\extender.bin: Extender state and metadata; can’t be changed. E.g. remembers endpoint addresses while the service is running.

This Jira issue—[[INVS-347 - Documentation for Extender]]—was created on 2020-12-10. My [[First meeting with Magnus Bellon]] was on 2021-01-08. Has [[Snow Extender]] changed since then, in ways that would affect documentation for [[Snow Extender]]? Are there any limitations for the amount of data [[Snow Extender]] can handle? From where can [[Snow Extender]] be downloaded? Is [[Snow Extender]] updated via SUS, is it self-updating, or what?
https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/f76d9ebb-60ed-47d3-8f75-2484c0a5eee4 [[Ulf Bragnell]]: […] Extender is kind of our on-premise gateway; all things happening on-premise goes through the Extender.

Alessandro Big Sur is getting installed everywhere which makes it really urgent to support cloud metering. There’ll probably be a release in relation to this. ![[Pasted image 20201202095435.png]] When switching to the continuous release mode: will we keep track of feature releases or every release? Torbjörn: don’t know. Will decide during a day in the week, etc? Alessandro: after SIS 6.6, we’re going to the continuous release mode.

SLM Inventory #alessandro : [[Snow Inventory Server 6.6.0]] is out, and [[Snow Inventory Server 6.6.1]] is out today or tomorrow. The Snow Inventory Agent for Windows vulnerability recommends to change a configuration and use the Inventory Server Admin Console; there’s an issue there that prevents customers to change that. The change was planned for 6.7, but will be released today or tomorrow. [[Torbjörn Bergan]]: how does that work […] [[Alessandro Badin]]: […] it will still be depending on 6.

[[Snow Inventory Server 6.7.0]] Still RTM on [[2021-04-07]]. SNaaS [[Sara Skenhall]]: when is SNaaS released? [[Torbjörn Bergan]]: EA still end of March, end of Q1. This is what we’re going for. We don’t have the first customer checked yet. Could be delayed a few weeks. Still, the end of Q1 is what counts for the first customer. Planning for GA remains, which is a project in itself. [[Niklas Pivic]]: I’m documenting Extender and the ‘agent packager’ in SNaaS.
